p: In Krzysztof Kluk’s plant dictionary (“Dykcjonarz roślinny”, 18th c.), the colloquial name “draganek” is given, with the information that it grows in gardens, has lanceolate leaves, tasting “very spicy and pleasant”, which strengthen the stomach, “are suitable for salads and seasoning dishes; the vinegar containing these leaves can be very useful on the table” ( Kluk, 1805).
